name: Math.Matrix4

values.name: fromRecord
values.comment: Convert a record to a matrix.
values.type: { m11 : Basics.Float, m21 : Basics.Float, m31 : Basics.Float, m41 : Basics.Float, m12 : Basics.Float, m22 : Basics.Float, m32 : Basics.Float, m42 : Basics.Float, m13 : Basics.Float, m23 : Basics.Float, m33 : Basics.Float, m43 : Basics.Float, m14 : Basics.Float, m24 : Basics.Float, m34 : Basics.Float, m44 : Basics.Float } -> Math.Matrix4.Mat4

values.name: identity
values.comment: A matrix with all 0s, except 1s on the diagonal.

values.name: inverse
values.comment:
Computes the inverse of any matrix. This is somewhat computationally
intensive. If the matrix is not invertible, `Nothing` is returned.

values.name: inverseOrthonormal
values.comment:
Computes the inverse of the given matrix, assuming that the matrix is
orthonormal. This algorithm is more efficient than general matrix inversion, and
has no possibility of failing.

values.name: makeBasis
values.comment: Creates a transform from a basis consisting of 3 linearly independent vectors.

values.name: makeFrustum
values.comment:
Creates a matrix for a projection frustum with the given parameters.

Parameters:

  - left - the left coordinate of the frustum
  - right- the right coordinate of the frustum
  - bottom - the bottom coordinate of the frustum
  - top - the top coordinate of the frustum
  - znear - the near z distance of the frustum
  - zfar - the far z distance of the frustum
values.type: Basics.Float -> Basics.Float -> Basics.Float -> Basics.Float -> Basics.Float -> Basics.Float -> Math.Matrix4.Mat4

values.name: makeLookAt
values.comment:
Creates a transformation matrix for a camera.

Parameters:

  - eye - The location of the camera
  - center - The location of the focused object
  - up - The "up" direction according to the camera

values.name: makeOrtho
values.comment:
Creates a matrix for an orthogonal frustum projection with the given parameters.

Parameters:

  - left - the left coordinate of the frustum
  - right- the right coordinate of the frustum
  - bottom - the bottom coordinate of the frustum
  - top - the top coordinate of the frustum
  - znear - the near z distance of the frustum
  - zfar - the far z distance of the frustum
values.type: Basics.Float -> Basics.Float -> Basics.Float -> Basics.Float -> Basics.Float -> Basics.Float -> Math.Matrix4.Mat4

values.name: makeOrtho2D
values.comment:
Creates a matrix for a 2D orthogonal frustum projection with the given
parameters. `znear` and `zfar` are assumed to be -1 and 1, respectively.

Parameters:

  - left - the left coordinate of the frustum
  - right- the right coordinate of the frustum
  - bottom - the bottom coordinate of the frustum
  - top - the top coordinate of the frustum

values.name: makePerspective
values.comment:
Creates a matrix for a perspective projection with the given parameters.

Parameters:

  - fovy - field of view in the y axis, in degrees
  - aspect - aspect ratio
  - znear - the near z distance of the projection
  - zfar - the far z distance of the projection

values.name: makeRotate
values.comment:
Creates a transformation matrix for rotation in radians about the
3-element vector axis.

values.name: makeScale
values.comment:
Creates a transformation matrix for scaling each of the x, y, and z axes by
the amount given in the corresponding element of the 3-element vector.

values.name: makeScale3
values.comment:
Creates a transformation matrix for scaling by 3 scalar values, one for
each of the x, y, and z directions.

values.name: makeTranslate
values.comment:
Creates a transformation matrix for translating each of the x, y, and z
axes by the amount given in the corresponding element of the 3-element vector.

values.name: makeTranslate3
values.comment:
Creates a transformation matrix for translating by 3 scalar values, one for
each of the x, y, and z directions.

values.name: mul
values.comment: Matrix multiplcation: a * b

values.name: mulAffine
values.comment: Matrix multiplication, assuming a and b are affine: a * b

values.name: rotate
values.comment: Concatenates a rotation in radians about an axis to the given matrix.

values.name: scale
values.comment: Concatenates a scaling to the given matrix.

values.name: scale3
values.comment: Concatenates a scaling to the given matrix.

values.name: toRecord
values.comment: Convert a matrix to a record. Elements are given by their row and column indices, starting at 1, so `m23` means the element in the second row, third column.
values.type: Math.Matrix4.Mat4 -> { m11 : Basics.Float, m21 : Basics.Float, m31 : Basics.Float, m41 : Basics.Float, m12 : Basics.Float, m22 : Basics.Float, m32 : Basics.Float, m42 : Basics.Float, m13 : Basics.Float, m23 : Basics.Float, m33 : Basics.Float, m43 : Basics.Float, m14 : Basics.Float, m24 : Basics.Float, m34 : Basics.Float, m44 : Basics.Float }

values.name: transform
values.comment: Multiply a vector by a 4x4 matrix: m * v

values.name: translate
values.comment: Concatenates a translation to the given matrix.

values.name: translate3
values.comment: Concatenates a translation to the given matrix.

values.name: transpose
values.comment:
"Flip" the matrix across the diagonal by swapping row index and column
index.

name: Math.Vector2

values.name: add
values.comment: Vector addition: a + b

values.name: direction
values.comment: The normalized direction from b to a: (a - b) / |a - b|

values.name: distance
values.comment: The distance between two vectors.

values.name: distanceSquared
values.comment: The square of the distance between two vectors.

values.name: dot
values.comment: The dot product of a and b

values.name: fromRecord
values.comment: Convert a record to a vector.

values.name: getX
values.comment: Extract the x component of a vector.

values.name: getY
values.comment: Extract the y component of a vector.

values.name: length
values.comment: The length of the given vector: |a|

values.name: lengthSquared
values.comment: The square of the length of the given vector: |a| * |a|

values.name: negate
values.comment: Vector negation: -a

values.name: normalize
values.comment: A unit vector with the same direction as the given vector: a / |a|

values.name: scale
values.comment: Multiply the vector by a scalar: s * v

values.name: setX
values.comment: Update the x component of a vector, returning a new vector.

values.name: setY
values.comment: Update the y component of a vector, returning a new vector.

values.name: sub
values.comment: Vector subtraction: a - b

values.name: toRecord
values.comment: Convert a vector to a record.

values.name: vec2
values.comment: Creates a new 2-element vector with the given values.

name: Math.Vector3

values.name: direction

values.name: distance
values.comment: The distance between two vectors.

values.name: distanceSquared

values.comment: The dot product of a and b

values.name: getX
values.comment: Extract the x component of a vector.

values.name: getY
values.comment: Extract the y component of a vector.

values.name: getZ
values.comment: Extract the z component of a vector.

values.name: i
values.comment: The unit vector î which points in the x direction: `vec3 1 0 0`

values.name: j
values.comment: The unit vector ĵ which points in the y direction: `vec3 0 1 0`

values.name: k
values.comment: The unit vector k̂ which points in the z direction: `vec3 0 0 1`

values.name: length
values.comment: The length of the given vector: |a|

values.name: lengthSquared
values.comment: The square of the length of the given vector: |a| * |a|

values.name: negate
values.comment: Vector negation: -a

values.name: normalize
values.comment: A unit vector with the same direction as the given vector: a / |a|

values.name: scale
values.comment: Multiply the vector by a scalar: s * v

values.name: setX
values.comment: Update the x component of a vector, returning a new vector.

values.name: setY
values.comment: Update the y component of a vector, returning a new vector.

values.name: setZ
values.comment: Update the z component of a vector, returning a new vector.

values.name: sub
values.comment: Vector subtraction: a - b

values.name: toRecord
values.comment: Convert a vector to a record.
values.type: Math.Vector3.Vec3 -> { x : Basics.Float, y : Basics.Float, z : Basics.Float }

values.name: vec3
values.comment: Creates a new 3-element vector with the given values.
